name: The Unearthly Glade
tagline: An infuriating profusion of watery ditches and mud-choked pathways.
description: An infuriating profusion of watery ditches and mud-choked pathways.

points_of_interest.name: The Unearthly Glade
points_of_interest.description: Deep in the quiet calm of the airy beech woods in this hex, a wide glade is overrun with sighing grasses. This place has an odd air, feeling dreamy, welcoming, and yet also somehow forbidding.
points_of_interest.interior: Arcane spell-casters and fairies sense something wrong or unnatural about this glade, as if space itself were twisted or broken here. Detection of magic, invisibility, or dimensional warping reveal a 20′ dome of magical energy at the centre of the glade. Once thus detected, the dome may be touched, revealing a shimmering, silver door that leads into a parallel dimensional space.
special_features: Unnatural sensations for arcane spell-casters and fairies
20′ dome of magical energy at centre
Shimmering silver door to parallel dimension

points_of_interest.name: The Parallel Glade
points_of_interest.description: Entering the door in the invisible dome, one appears at the edge of a glade nearly identical to that in which the dome stands, with a few key differences.
points_of_interest.entering: Enter through the shimmering silver door in the dome
points_of_interest.interior: This glade is always veiled in night, lit by a full moon. The glade is surrounded by mists. At the glade's centre, where the invisible dome is located in the real world, stands the Norstone.
points_of_interest.leaving: Entering the mist causes one to reappear in the original glade, beside the door in the dome.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: The Audrune Morthgwail and his two dire wolves

points_of_interest.name: Norstone
points_of_interest.description: A great, square monolith of red/purple-striated stone—20′ tall and 8′ to a side. It can only be seen and accessed in the parallel glade.
points_of_interest.interior: Drunic runes describe the arcane spell Dimension Door. When touched by an arcane spell-caster of Level 7 or higher, the stone thrums, vibrates, and exudes a violet plasma in which babbling, spectral faces form.
points_of_interest.exploring: Anyone approaching the stone attracts the attention of the Audrune Morthgwail and his two dire wolves. There is a 3-in-6 chance of him being already present (invisible) in the glade; if not, he arrives from Dolmenwood within 1d3 Turns.
special_features: Hidden - only accessible in parallel glade
Spectral faces appear when touched by Level 7+ arcane caster
secrets: Phantoms speak in Old Drunic and reveal secret arts for manipulating space and time
Conversing with phantoms reduces research time and cost of teleportation magic by 25%

npcs.name: The Audrune Morthgwail
npcs.title: Stone Ward
npcs.description: An old human man, stick thin and stooped, with missing teeth, goggling eyes, and a white beard to his belly. He dresses in the traditional night-black cloak and hood of his order. Morthgwail wanders the woods around the nodal glade, living in the wilds without domicile.
demeanor: Tilts his head to one side then the other when speaking
npcs.speech: Toothless whistle. Veers erratically between topics.
possessions: A twisted elm Staff of Dominion (Animals) with 7 charges

items.name: Staff of Dominion (Animals)
items.description: A twisted elm staff with 7 charges
items.mechanical_effect: Staff of Dominion (Animals, p416) with 7 charges
